Summary One of the most experienced problem solvers in Intel with 22-year well recognized managerial and technical skills. 17 years of packaging technology development experience. Had been instrumental in the development of numerous advanced high density interconnection assembly packaging technologies for Intel CPU, Chipset and SOC products, i.e. Wire Bonding Ceramic PGA and Plastic LGA; Flip Chip PGA, Flip Chip BGA, Flip Chip Molded Matrix BGA (with mold or interposer) and the most recent Thermal Compression Bonding FCBGA.  
 
8 years of senior manager position in assembly process engineering, statistician, industrial engineering, assembly technology pathfinding, materials, thermal and mechanical core competency groups. Well recognized for his passion in people and organization development in conducting many self-developed courses. Five years ago, after completed managing the most complex packaging technology pathfinding then in Intel and handed it over to the development phase, stepped up to be the technical lead in the entire technology development to ensure its success. Established a new problem solving methodology named as Fundamentals Based Investigation with significant time reduction in problem solving. Continued technical career path in the largest Intel factory in Malaysia to resolve and avoid various complex issues. Master mind of the worldwide Intel manufacturing sites on the Marginal Tool Policy and established an automated tool performance triggering system. 
 
A Master of Science in Materials Engineering. Hold five US patents and five trade secrets and published numerous papers (mostly internal for intellectual properties control). Chaired the iNEMI Asia Packaging Technical Group to identify projects for industry collaboration for 1.5 years. Experience Staff Manufacturing Technologist Intel Corporation June 2009  – Present (6 years 3 months) A content expert in the advanced assembly technology and the packaging assembly processes focusing on resolving complex technical issues. Lead in a equipment improvement policy. Conduct classes, sharing and coaching on technical problem solving methods and people soft skills. Senior Manager Intel Corporation January 2002  –  September 2009  (7 years 9 months) Kulim, Malaysia Assembly Modules, Statisticians, Industrial Engineering Manager (Manager/Sr. Manager) [Jan 2002 to Sept 2006] 
 
Assembly Technology Pathfinding and Core Competency (Materials, Thermal/Mechanical/Fluid) Sr. Manager [Sept 2006 to June 2009] 
 
Sr. Assembly/Materials Technologist (Sr. Staff Engineer) [June 2009 to Dec 2010] 
- Lead engineer on an advanced Package-On-Package (POP) packaging technology 
 
Sr. Assembly/Materials Technologist (Sr. Staff Engineer) [Dec 2010 to April 2015] 
- Assembly technical expert and leader to drive for defect free manufacturing. Worldwide factory lead in problem solving and marginal equipment policy and triggering system.  Senior Manager Intel Corporation April 2004  –  June 2009  (5 years 3 months) Managed and led ATD-M Module Engineering team to develop several packaging technologies. Successfully certified a few flip chip and wire bond technologies (FCBGA1 1mm, FCBGA1b.Cy, FCBGA2 ext and PBGA (ICH4-CR)) in 2002. Developed and certified FCBGA3 (Ph 1a & 1b) and PBGA (ICH5, ICH6) in 2003. Delivered PBGA3, lead free FCBGA3 (Ph 1, 2 & 3), lead free FCBGA1 & FCBGA2 and 1265 Pathfinding technologies in 2004. In 2005, orchestrated an organization restructure and managed the Industrial Engineers and the Statistician Groups to complement Module Engineering. Delivered technology certification of FCBGA7 (Ph1 & 2) and FCMMAP (2L) in 2006.  
Managed the FCBGA9 (Ph1 & 2) Pathfinding programs. Later also managed the ATD-M Materials Core Competency Group, the Thermal Mechanical Tool and Analysis (TMTA) Core Competency Group and the Pathfinding organization in Q4 2006 to develop the FCBGA9.E2 and two other emerging flip chip technology programs. Managed the pathfinding team to successfully deliver the most complex packaging technology for the smallest and the thinnest chip for smartphone and tablet application. Summary Having careers with well-established Japanese and US corporations as Multinational Sales and Marketing, New business development activities in Hong Kong/China and Japan with Trilingual capabilities (English/Japanese/Chinese). Received over 8 recognitions for design wins and sales achievements, two times of “Exceeds Expectations” which is the second highest and received the highest “Outstanding” rating on 2013 on the annual focal in Intel. 
 
- 1st Tier Large Japanese and US corporation working experiences. 
- MNC sales and marketing, engineering design-win and design-in activities on electronics devices, semiconductor strategic planning. 
- Technical knowledge on hardware, software supports.  
- Full skill sets on new business development in APAC and Japan regions. 
- Initiate and build strategies to drive the new projects from ground up to execution. 
- Succesfully closed a large first ever fuondry deal with public annoucement in July 2014. 
- Good at out-of-box thinking, foreseen the new coming trend for new business development.  
- GPTW (Great Place To Work) core member to improve working environment. 
- Good sense of humor (I guess..) 
 
Skills: Trilingual skills (English, Japanese and Chinese) and understand the cultures very well. 
15y+ working experienced in US, APAC and Japanese.
